item.title: Hacker News Top Stories: Wednesday, March 12, 2025 at 5:15 AM UTC
item.description:
1. Happy 20th Birthday, Y Combinator (1048 points | 209 comments)
2. Beyond Diffusion: Inductive Moment Matching (32 points | 5 comments)
3. Show HN: VSC – An open source 3D Rendering Engine in C++ (29 points | 2 comments)
4. The Startup CTO's Handbook (162 points | 39 comments)
5. Fastplotlib: GPU-accelerated, fast, and interactive plotting library (365 points | 132 comments)
6. Internationalization-puzzles: Daily programming puzzles just like Advent of Code (14 points | discuss)
7. Happy 10k Day (85 points | 49 comments)
8. New tools for building agents (302 points | 112 comments)
9. Show HN: Factorio Learning Environment – Agents Build Factories (641 points | 185 comments)
10. NASA to launch space observatory that will map 450M galaxies (202 points | 72 comments)
11. Sorting algorithms with CUDA (69 points | 16 comments)
12. Launch HN: Sift Dev (YC W25) – AI-Powered Datadog Alternative (62 points | 44 comments)
13. A look at the creative process behind Bluey and Cocomelon (57 points | 42 comments)
14. The US island that speaks Elizabethan English (214 points | 120 comments)
15. A 10x Faster TypeScript (1503 points | 675 comments)
16. Australian man survives 100 days with artificial heart (135 points | 27 comments)
17. Show HN: XPipe, a shell connection hub for SSH, Docker, K8s, VMs, and more (6 points | discuss)
18. In contrast to Earth, Mars's middle atmosphere appears driven by gravity waves (59 points | 18 comments)
19. AI-Generated Voice Evidence Poses Dangers in Court (127 points | 90 comments)
20. Show HN: Krep a High-Performance String Search Utility Written in C (131 points | 54 comments)
21. Continue (YC S23) Is Hiring a Software Engineer in San Francisco ( | hide)
22. What makes code hard to read: Visual patterns of complexity (2023) (300 points | 293 comments)
23. NIST selects HQC as fifth algorithm for post-quantum encryption (145 points | 101 comments)
24. Tesco trials giant trolley scales in Gateshead (14 points | 24 comments)
25. Show HN: We built a Plug-in Home Battery for the 99.7% of us without Powerwalls (259 points | 397 comments)
26. Modern Baby: A pioneering computer from Manchester (60 points | 7 comments)
27. When Crocodiles Attack: The Ramree Island Massacre (2013) (46 points | 51 comments)
28. The Early History of Deferred Shading and Lighting (16 points | 2 comments)
29. Mapping the University of Chicago's 135-year expansion into Hyde Park and beyond (197 points | 70 comments)
30. How do we tell truths that might hurt? (1975) (45 points | 42 comments)
